page.title: 10INDUSTRY
page.content: {INDUSTRY The main industrial site in the sector is Grove Wharf.The wharf is owned by J. Wharton (Shipping) Ltd., a company first established in 1890 on the River Trent.The wharf is about 45 nautical miles from the mouth of the River Humber and is established on the east bank of the River Trent.Grove Wharf has berths for 8 sea going vessels which are restricted to a maximum length of 95metres and a depth of 5.3metres.The berths handle 1.5million tonnes of bulk cargo a year.This consists mainly of pre- packed timber, coal, fertilizers, scrap metal, metallic ores and stone. The cargo is moved by shore cranes and small mechanical diggers working in the ships hold.The cargo vessels arrive from the EEC countries, Scandinavia, and North Africa with
